definition: to drape over one's shoulders/to open/to unroll/to split open/to spread out

sentences.english: The woman threw a shawl over her shoulders.
sentences.chinese: 那女人猛然地披上披巾在肩膀上。

sentences.english: She wore a shawl over her shoulders.
Old women in black shawls peered at us from doorways.
sentences.chinese: 裹着黑披巾的老婦人在門口盯着我們。

sentences.english: She wore a white shawl over her shoulders.
sentences.chinese: 她肩上披着一條白披巾。

sentences.english: Let me double the shawl and put it round you.
sentences.chinese: 讓我把這披巾折起來圍在你身上。

sentences.english: The design and color of the shawl is full of national traits.
sentences.chinese: 那條披巾的花色具有濃郁的民族風情。

sentences.english: Round his neck he wore a green shawl.
sentences.chinese: 他脖子裏圍着一條綠色的在披巾。

sentences.english: A black shawl is the most versatile cover-up accessory for evening wear.
sentences.chinese: 一條黑色披巾是晚禮服的最佳搭配裝飾。

definition: cape/shawl/(of long hair) to trail over one's shoulders
cloth head covering worn by men in ancient times/headscarf (typically worn by women)/kerchief/turban
Chinese-style long robe worn as outermost garment/burqa
